Edward Scissorhands 25th Anniversary.
Tim Burton's Edward Scissorhands opens as an eccentric inventor (Vincent 
Price) lovingly assembles a synthetic youth named Edward (Johnny Depp). 
Edward has all the essential ingredients for today's standard body, with 
the exception of a pair of hands. For what is initially thought to be a 
temporary period, he is fitted with long, scissor-like extremities that, 
while able to trim a mean hedge, are hardly conducive to day-to-day life. 
When the kindly inventor dies, however, Edward is left lonely and cursed 
with some very heavy metal for hands. He is eventually taken in by Peg Boggs 
(Dianne Weist), an Avon lady who takes pity on him after seeing his bleak 
existence. Edward, in spite of his inherent ability to slay anyone he comes 
across, is a gentle soul whose only wish is to be loved. His impromptu family 
has, at best, a limited understanding of Edward, but he finds himself drawn 
to Peg's weary but sympathetic daughter, Kim (Winona Ryder), who is dating 
Jim (Anthony Michael Hall), the neighbourhood bully. Meanwhile, Edward finds 
himself a local celebrity after the town realizes that his talents include 
creative hedge trimming and an unrivalled ability to cut hair. His so-called 
friends are proven fair-weather when Edward is accused of a crime, after 
which his only supporters are Peg and Kim.
